ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer.box2d
Class Box2DWorld

java.lang.Object
  ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer.box2d.Box2DWorld

public class Box2DWorld
extends java.lang.Object

This is an abstraction for the interaction of the graphics library with the physics engine. The physics engine that is used in the proof of concept applications is Box2D, a 2D physics engine that is independent from any form of rendering.
This class represents the physical world, with a ground body, i.e. a ground surface.

Constructor Summary

          Creates a World, where all the elements will live in.

Box2DWorld

public Box2DWorld(javax.vecmath.Vector2f low,
                  javax.vecmath.Vector2f high,
                  javax.vecmath.Vector2f gravity)
Creates a World, where all the elements will live in.

Parameters:
low - the lowest point (x, y) of the world
high - the highest point (x,y) of the world
gravity - the gravity of the world
Method Detail

step

public void step(float dt,
                 int velocityIterations,
                 int positionIterations)
Executes a step in the physics simulation. This is done several times a second to have a constant flow in the simulation. All the new positions are calculated, taking into account collisions that occur, joints that have been made, etc.s

Parameters:
dt - the amount of time to simulate. Should be constant.
velocityIterations - for the velocity constraint solver
positionIterations - for the position constraint solver

setGroundBody

public void setGroundBody(Box2DBody body)
Sets the ground body.

Parameters:
body - the new ground body
